org.jmesa.core.filter
Interface FilterMatcher

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPatternFilterMatcher, DateFilterMatcher, DateTimeFilterMatcher, NumberFilterMatcher, StringFilterMatcher, StringWildCardFilterMatcher
public interface FilterMatcher

Used to filter out values.

The following is a String matching example: 

 public boolean evaluate(Object itemValue, String matchValue) {
     String value = StringUtils.lowerCase((String) itemValue);
     if (StringUtils.contains(value, matchValue)) {
         return true;
     }
 
     return false;
 }

Since:
2.0
Author:
Jeff Johnston

Method Summary
 boolean evaluate(Object itemValue, String filterValue)
           Take the current item value and evaluate whether or not it is the same as the match value.
 

Method Detail

evaluate

boolean evaluate(Object itemValue,
                 String filterValue)

Take the current item value and evaluate whether or not it is the same as the match value.

Parameters:
itemValue - The value that will be performing the match against.
filterValue - The value to match with.
Returns:
Is true if the itemValue and the matchValue are the same.
